p: The results of the antifungal activity of Mentha spp. EOs are highly divergent, and it is possible to observe that M. suaveolens EO [ 66] was more active on Candida spp. than M. longifolia EO [ 63], followed by M. piperita EO with MIC values of 225 μg/mL to 256 μg/mL [ 52, 53]. M. spicata EO was more active on dermatophytes, with values of MIC of 0.25 μg/mL [ 54], and Aspergillus spp. with an MIC value of 313 μg/mL [ 59], while M. suaveolens EO was more active on Aspergillus spp. with values of MIC of 6.8 μg/mL [ 43].
